p: ANOVA results for the effect of five variables were implemented using Design Expert software (version 7.1.5) to investigate the suitability and significance of the final model ( Table 3). The quadratic model was significant with F-value (2,479.87) and P-value (<0.0001), and the lack of fit was not significant toward the response (droplet size). All linear mixture components (A, B, C, D, and E) from Equation 6 were adequate in the response based on their coefficients and the P-value of the linear mixture. The regression coefficient results for the final reduced model ( Table 4) showed that the predicted R 2 (0.9109) was in true agreement with the adjusted R 2 (0.9995). According to the results obtained, >90% of the response variations in the independent variables (droplet size) can be explained by the D-optimal MED as a function of the main composition.
